str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A mother-in-law. Feminine of pentheros; a wife's mother.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To be sick with a fever. From pura; to be on fire, i.e., to have a fever.
